comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009]  Thanks mich. It could be the Bondi outfall stack with a much closer building in front.

Building in right foreground is the Federal Hotel.
See comment  photo above:

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content:
When widened, this was to be the main route connecting Lane Cove Road (now the Pacific Highway) to the Bridge. It was the scene of monumental traffic jams and caused the Warringah Expressway to be constructed in the 1960's.
The Bridge had already opened by the date of this photo.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Bondi outfall stack would be out of shot on the left.   The low ground behind Shark Island leads to Bondi   and the stack would be left of that,.
